title: In Victorian England, how were men who had extramarital affairs perceived by society? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pretty much the way they are now I suspect. As long as they provided for their wife and children, no one gave a crap what they did outside the home. Women, of course, were not afforded the same freedom. Once they were married, they belonged to their husbands, and if they dared to even look at another man they would be cast out into the street, shamed for eternity. But men could stick it where they wanted as long as they kept up the illusion of being “a good family man” Kind of depressing to realise not a lot has changed all that much, isn’t it?
